definitions.definition: a tall narrow building or part of a building, especially of a church or castle

examples.text: The castle is rectangular in shape, with a tower at each corner.
Armed guards manned the lookout towers.
They lived in a ten-storey tower in the town centre.
Twin towers flanked the castle gateway.
the spot where the towers once stood
The brick tower was built in around four months.

definitions.definition: a tall structure used for sending television or radio signals
a tall piece of furniture used for storing things
a person that you can rely on to help, protect and comfort you when you are in trouble

examples.text: He was a tower of strength to his sisters when their father died.

wordOrigin: Old English torr, reinforced in Middle English by Old French tour, from Latin turris, from Greek.
